title: (x) Morgan Stanley wordmark - custom designed (similar to Trade Gothic) {Jarrod Beglinger, (Marc O)}
content:
Looking for a typeface like the new Morgan Stanley wordmark?

Many Thanks - JBO1

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MS_new_180_4777.jpg)
author: JB01

comments.content:
This looks to me like a customized version of Trade Gothic, News Gothic, Benton Sans, Franklin Gothic, etc. But if you're looking for a face that has some of the distinctive characters already included...

Akkurat has the curved l but not the one-story g.  
 [http://lineto.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/lineto.com/ "http://lineto.com/")

Flama has the curved l and one-story g, but DIN-like construction.  
 [http://vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/")

Foco has the desired features but adds a hint of calligraphic construction.  
 [http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco "http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco")

side note:  
maybe you already knew this, but they are custom letterforms.

there is a nice story about it here:  
 [http://www.identityworks.com/reviews/2006/morgan\_stanley.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/www.identityworks.com/reviews/2006/morgan_stanley.htm "http://www.identityworks.com/reviews/2006/morgan\_stanley.htm")

and a more detailed description of the letterform design here:  
 [http://www.carbonesmolan.com/morganstanley/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/www.carbonesmolan.com/morganstanley/ "http://www.carbonesmolan.com/morganstanley/")

I can get your single-storey 'g' and tailed 'l', but not the double 'a':  
 [FF Schulbuch](http://web.archive.org/web/20130811154925/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=FF.2797.0.0&fontRendererText=Morgan+Stanley)
